original_solution_mapping.L1: He invited 10 friends but he didn't need to cook for 1 of his friends so that left 10-1 = <<10-1=9>>9 friends to cook for.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He was cooking 3 burgers per 9 guests so 3*9 = <<3*9=27>>27 burgers
original_solution_mapping.L3: He needed 27 burger buns but 1 guest wouldn't eat the buns so now he needs 27-3 = <<27-3=24>>24
original_solution_mapping.L4: He will need to buy 24 buns and they come 8 to a pack so he needs 24/8 = <<24/8=3>>3 packs of buns

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4239.
    Returns: the number of packs of buns Alex needed to buy.
    """
    # L1
    invited_friends = 10 # invited 10 friends
    friends_not_eating_meat = 1 # 1 of his friends didn't eat meat
    friends_to_cook_for = invited_friends - friends_not_eating_meat

    # L2
    burgers_per_guest = 3 # cook 3 burgers for each guest
    total_burgers_needed = burgers_per_guest * friends_to_cook_for

    # L3
    friends_not_eating_bread = 1 # Another one of his friends didn't eat bread
    buns_needed_after_adjustment = total_burgers_needed - burgers_per_guest

    # L4
    buns_per_pack = 8 # The burger buns came 8 to a pack
    packs_of_buns_needed = buns_needed_after_adjustment / buns_per_pack

    # FA
    answer = packs_of_buns_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He invited {invited_friends} friends but he didn't need to cook for {friends_not_eating_meat} of his friends so that left {invited_friends}-{friends_not_eating_meat} = <<{invited_friends}-{friends_not_eating_meat}={friends_to_cook_for}>>{friends_to_cook_for} friends to cook for.

He was cooking {burgers_per_guest} burgers per {friends_to_cook_for} guests so {burgers_per_guest}*{friends_to_cook_for} = <<{burgers_per_guest}*{friends_to_cook_for}={total_burgers_needed}>>{total_burgers_needed} burgers

He needed {total_burgers_needed} burger buns but {friends_not_eating_bread} guest wouldn't eat the buns so now he needs {total_burgers_needed}-{burgers_per_guest} = <<{total_burgers_needed}-{burgers_per_guest}={buns_needed_after_adjustment}>>{buns_needed_after_adjustment}

He will need to buy {buns_needed_after_adjustment} buns and they come {buns_per_pack} to a pack so he needs {buns_needed_after_adjustment}/{buns_per_pack} = <<{buns_needed_after_adjustment}/{buns_per_pack}={packs_of_buns_needed}>>{packs_of_buns_needed} packs of buns

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He invited 10 friends but he didn't need to cook for 1 of his friends so that left 10-1 = <<10-1=9>>9 friends to cook for.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He was cooking 3 burgers per 9 guests so 3*9 = <<3*9=27>>27 burgers
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He needed 27 burger buns but 1 guest wouldn't eat the buns so now he needs 27-3 = <<27-3=24>>24
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: He will need to buy 24 buns and they come 8 to a pack so he needs 24/8 = <<24/8=16>>16 packs of buns

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '-' instead.
